name: Cotswolds88hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed on a Saturday night on a dinner, bed and breakfast rate in a room with a view: and thought it was a great price for a great hotel. Rooms are the smallest in the hotel but have everything you need. Very comfortable bed, plenty of space for 2 people to get around without bumping into each other, nice linen, big soft towels, robes, Molton Brown samples. They also have real coffee and a cafetiere in the room, although milk is UHT, just ask for a jug of fresh to take up with you. Air conditioning is quiet and works well as the room is hot on a hot night. These rooms are totally adequate for a short stay and honestly wouldn't bother spending more on a bigger room. And of course the view is simply to die for especially on a misty morning.
reviews.title: fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room downsides: clutching at straws here but 3 things that drive me crazy in hotel rooms: 1) when I have to "tidy" before I can "use" - example the towels were all beautifully folded in piles in the shower, looked lovely, but I have to sort them out and put them away before I can shower so ultimately pointless and 2) there is never enough hooks or rails to hang wet towels and 3) bathroom mirrors that are useless for putting on makeup (girls opinion of course).
reviews.title: 80s mod in the Cotswolds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was immaculate both in the bar and restaurant in the evening and at breakfast. Dinner in the restaurant was amazing, menu was expertly put together, quality ingredients, beautifully presented and tasted just sublime, testament to a great chef. Restaurant staff are thoughtful and absolutely the right balance between attention and distance.
reviews.title: Some ups and downs (and I'm not talking about the rolling hills)

reviews.text: The continental breakfast was simple with fresh fruit, cereal, pastries and the hotel offers a variety of cooked options. My husband had eggs benedict and said the eggs were the best he'd tasted after our own chickens' eggs. I saw a full english being delivered to a table next to us and it did look very good (smelt even better). Good fresh coffee and fresh juice. My disappointment here given the quality of everything else: just plain white and brown sliced bread for toast - could have done much better there with some different and perhaps home made bread options.
reviews.title: Refreshingly different.
Wedding July 23rd 2011
reviews.text: This is an expensive hotel near the center of the small town of Painswick. It is an unusual hotel since it is decorated in a modern style with animal rugs and furnishings, weird mirrors and lighting- ind of a trip. The rooms are very comfortable. The breakfast was disappointing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and boyfriend stayed here for our one year anniversary, we stumbled across it when we did a google search, and am I glad we did.
reviews.title: Absolutely Outstanding

reviews.text: From the moment we entered the hotel we felt special, the staff were fantastic always making sure we had what we needed, but not in a overpowering way were it can get annoying
reviews.title: Breathtaking hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a room with the feature bath, this was one of the reasons for booking the room, when I went to have a bath i could not find the pluig, so i asked reception to find me one, they one they brought me was to big so they upgraded us to a room with a four poster bed in (which was huge) and a jacuzzi bath, lets say i was not putting up a struggle to stay in this room:-)
reviews.title: Lovely stay, great food in a lovely location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the rooms are different each with there own style, we ate in the restaurant, the staff were again fantastic, they even have a plasma in the restuurant so you can see you dish been plated up, The food was out of this world, i had haddock with a chicken wing on top, you would think they would not go together but it tasted lovely. When we returned to our room we had a gift hanging on the door handle, a lovely golden bag filled with Molton Brown Goodies, and when we entered the room the bed had sweets laid on it for us, what a lovely touch.
reviews.title: Superb visit!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds around the hotel are beautiful, i had a little wander into the rooms near reception and outside in the morning. The hotel is filled with quirky things, gives it a lot od character.
reviews.title: Super little hotel and we will definitely revisit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the detmar room and the views from room 16 were superb and as promised by the receptionist on check in. We wanted to try the taster menu for dinner and the 7 courses were excellent; wine accompanying was ok and could have been delivered quicker but that certainly did not detract from an excellent meal with quality and quantity scoring well. Breakfast was also of a high standard. The room was very comfortable and spotlessly clean the turn down service also providing a few nice touches. The night wasn't cheap but certainly outstanding value for money. Have read some negative comments about staff but have to say we thought they were all excellent and the chef is top class!
reviews.title: Not cheap but outstanding value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The town of Painswick is not a place I would go back too - not a traditional Cotswold country town, not many (any) cute shops and not a pub I would go to, so for me, Cotswold 88 Hotel was a stand alone attraction. Good location for exploring more rural areas e.g. Woolpack inn and a base for walks (Sapperton is well worth a visit).
reviews.title: Stark contrast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The exterior is very grand and the inside is crazy! A headache here would not be well received. The communcal areas are all well appointed and well kept and the staff are delightful.
reviews.title: Overall nice but attitude of General Manager means we won't ever go back
Slightly disappointing room but beautiful views/gardens
reviews.text: The room (we stayed in a room with a view) was a good size, with small bathroom, fine for one night, but very cold. Heating was put on however.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Customer service very good - numerous requests for ice and fresh milk promptly received with a smile.
reviews.title: By far the best hotel we have visited (many times) in the UK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are wishing to stay at this hotel, please DO NOT BOOK ONLINE.
reviews.title: DO NOT BOOK ONLINE

reviews.text: I have always wanted to stay at Cotswold 88 and as our wedding is this year we thought it was the ideal time. Our wedding is in Painswick so this is the perfect place for us to stay.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, stunning location! Will visit again in the Autumn...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wedding is in September so we booked the hotel in February, so we wouldn't be disappointed. The booking went through and the deposit taken. 8 weeks before the wedding we get a phone call telling us they have double booked the room and we can no longer stay there. Apparently their computer system didn't recognise the booking, but i cant understand this when the money was taken!!! So we are now without a hotel for our wedding! Also there are no other hotels of this quality in Painswick so it means we will also have to pay for a taxi to get to another hotel. This is a complete nightmare and i cant believe a hotel of this standard can muck it up.
reviews.title: It was OK, but won't go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The manager phone us to apolgize and returned our money, he also promised us a voucher for cream tea - but surprise surprise this never arrived!!! Personally i think they owe us a free night or at least pay the taxi bill to another hotel. But they didn't offer us anything.
reviews.title: beautiful location and building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are thinking of staying here please please pick up the phone, so you are not left disappointed like we were.
reviews.title: Another curate's egg

description: Cotswolds88hotel is an intimate lifestyle boutique hotel set in the hauntingly beautiful village of Painswick. Here, the modern and vintage merge; the historic exterior and funky interior breathe new life into the foundations of this stunning country retreat. The hotels ethos is based on the latest lounge trend in which luxury and chill out blend together. Cotswolds88hotel - the ultimate destination for every traveller.
